page.title: 15LUNAN AREA, CLIMATE.
page.content: 1\The weather in this area is usually drier than in other parts of Scotland, we also enjoy many hours of sunshine even in th winter months. The temperatures are very rarely high,probably this area is slightly colder than the west coast of Scotland. However the summer of 1985 has been a particularly wet one, the wettest in this area for 200 years. As can be imagined the farmers have suffered greatly and so far it looks as if this harvest will be disastrous. It is now early October and some fields of grain are still not harvested, the protein peas which should be harvested dry are so wet that some farmers are considering ploughing them in. The schoolchildren are now on their autumn break, when many help with the potato picking, but due to rain,few tatties are harvested.
